Posts.Content: Oct 9, 2012 03:35PM Mariposa123 wrote: I got my results over the phone on a Friday at 4:30.  She didn't have all of the details, but did know I had tested positive for cancer in my Left breast and lymph node.  She wanted me to know so I could set up a Monday meeting with the oncologist- and she knew that they would get booked up if I didn't call that minute.  It was a horrible phone call- lots of crying, my husband holding me.  The weekend was full of crazy google searches and more crying - but  I am so glad she told me and we could get the ball rolling.  A phone call I will never forget.
Posts.Title: How did you hear biopsy results--phone or appt? frazzledmom schoolmom

Posts.Content: Feb 20, 2013 03:05PM Mariposa123 wrote: So sorry Mkelly422.  This website has been so important to me for support and information.  My heart goes out to you.  I know it is hard when you first find out and are waiting for those next steps.  Most people think this can be the hardest part.  Lean on your support as much as you can.  Sending you hugs.
Posts.Title: Biopsy tomorrow and scared! mkelly422 mkelly422

Posts.Content: Dec 18, 2012 01:46AM Mariposa123 wrote: Hi everyone,    Some of you I know from the chemo boards:-)  I will be having surgery some time in January, but unsure of when.  I did chemo first to shrink the tumor and my doctors wanted to ensure that the chemo they chose would be effective.  I am hoping it was- and my doctors all seem very hopeful.   I will be having a double mastectomy and I also heard a lot about the gummi bears (which seem like a good option- supposedly they have a nice natural shape and don't leak).  I am 45 years old and have two small children - 3 and 6. I am currently on disability but hope to be returning to work in March.  I will be having radiation after surgery.   Sorry to meet you all under these circumstances but glad we can all do this together!  I am also hoping very much that 2013 is an amazing wonderful year for all of us:-)
Posts.Title: January 2013 surgery JRMH Lbwagner69

Posts.Content: Dec 20, 2012 04:55PM Mariposa123 wrote: I was just told yesterday by my oncologist that they are resuming chemo for two more rounds:-(  (They had stopped early due to Neuropathy- but I am doing somewhat better at this point).  So - that means my surgery probably won't be until early February.  And it means I get chemo tomorrow- so  I will be sick for the holidays.  This whole cancer treatment thing sucks.  Anyway, I may stick around and learn from all of you on this board if that is okay:-)
Posts.Title: January 2013 surgery JRMH Lbwagner69
